repnme.cdata!:
Poland - Enterprise and Financial Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Enterprise and Financial Sector
            Adjustment Loan in Poland. The project's key objectives
            were to (i) improve the enterprise sector's
            responsiveness and ongoing adaptation to market signals, and
            to facilitate the exit of nonviable enterprises when unable
            to respond or adapt; and (ii) raise the level and quality of
            financial intermediation through better credit allocation
            and enhanced commercial bank capacity to impart and enforce
            financial discipline on banks' enterprise debtors.
            Bank's performance was highly satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was highly satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned were as follows: (i) importance of up-front
            establishment of enabling legislation; (ii) importance of
            donor coordination and responsible use of Technical
            Assistance (TA) for successful implementation and
            institution-building; and (iii) the importance of
            institutional capacity for successful project monitoring and evaluation.

5082276.majtheme: Public sector governance,Financial and private sector development,Economic management

repnme.cdata!:
Poland - Enterprise and Financial Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Enterprise and Financial Sector
            Adjustment Loan will support the Government Enterprise and
            Bank Restructuring and Privatization (EBRP) Program.  The
            EBRP Program is an integrated attempt at:  (a) dealing
            simultaneously with the debt overhang of state-owned
            enterprises (SOEs) and the portfolio problem in the banking
            system; and (b) resolving the root cause of the SOE crisis,
            i.e., the unclear structure of enterprise ownership and
            governance.  In addition, the loan will also support a
            comprehensive program to strengthen bank supervision, thus
            allowing more rapid bank privatization.
